diff_analysis.evidence: In Think/Db/Driver.class.php, parameter binding logic was weakened. In parseSet() and insert()/insertAll(), when a value starts with ':' and matches a bind key, the old code used the placeholder directly (e.g., '= :key') so PDO handled it safely. The new code instead passes that placeholder string through escapeString/parseValue, effectively inlining user-controlled data into SQL and bypassing prepared-statement parameterization. Combined with think_filter relaxing its operator blacklist (removing BIND/EXP from the pattern), this increases the risk of crafted input being concatenated into SQL expressions, introducing SQL injection (CWE-89).
